articles.headline: Apple Unveils Video Service With Celebrity Parade but Few Details
articles.snippet: The iPhone maker is partnering with Hollywood heavyweights and publishers to provide broad new services to its users.
articles.abstract: The iPhone maker is partnering with Hollywood heavyweights and publishers to provide broad new services to its users.
articles.lead_paragraph: CUPERTINO, Calif. — Apple unveiled a new video streaming service on Monday with a parade of celebrities rarely seen on a stage outside of Hollywood’s awards season, with heavyweight directors like Steven Spielberg and J. J. Abrams and stars like Octavia Spencer and Jennifer Aniston.
articles.byline: By Daisuke Wakabayashi and John Koblin

articles.headline: Roiled by Staff Uproar, Civil Rights Group Looks at Intolerance Within
articles.snippet: The Southern Poverty Law Center has become a crusading anti-hate empire, but current and former employees say its leaders have never dealt with internal strife.
articles.abstract: The Southern Poverty Law Center has become a crusading anti-hate empire, but current and former employees say its leaders have never dealt with internal strife.
articles.lead_paragraph: [For more coverage of race, sign up here to have our Race/Related newsletter delivered weekly to your inbox.]
articles.byline: By Audra D. S. Burch, Alan Blinder and John Eligon

articles.headline: An Ex-Fox News Host Pitched ‘Financial Freedom.’ His Clients Want Their Money Back.
articles.snippet: Clayton Morris has been sued by nearly two dozen customers who say they were sold ramshackle homes as investment properties.
articles.abstract: Clayton Morris has been sued by nearly two dozen customers who say they were sold ramshackle homes as investment properties.
articles.lead_paragraph: INDIANAPOLIS — Clayton Morris walked away from his job as a Fox News host in 2017 to devote himself to the next phase of his professional life: helping regular people achieve financial independence.

articles.headline: Trump and Republicans Seek to Turn the Tables in Post-Mueller Washington
articles.snippet: President Trump and his allies went on the offensive, vowing to pursue those responsible for the Russia investigation. President Trump called some of them “treasonous.”
articles.abstract: President Trump and his allies went on the offensive, vowing to pursue those responsible for the Russia investigation. President Trump called some of them “treasonous.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump and his Republican allies went on the offensive on Monday, vowing to pursue and even punish those responsible for the Russia investigation now that the special counsel has wrapped up without implicating him or his campaign in a criminal conspiracy to influence the 2016 election.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: Barr’s Declaration on Trump Puts Justice Dept. Back in Political Crucible
articles.snippet: The special counsel did not decide whether President Trump had obstructed justice, so the attorney general stepped in.
articles.abstract: The special counsel did not decide whether President Trump had obstructed justice, so the attorney general stepped in.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — William P. Barr was a lawyer in private practice in June when he wrote an unsolicited memo to the Justice Department that was sharply skeptical of the special counsel’s inquiry into whether President Trump illegally obstructed justice.
articles.byline: By Charlie Savage, Mark Mazzetti and Katie Benner

articles.headline: In Test of Boeing Jet, Pilots Had 40 Seconds to Fix Error
articles.snippet: They had just moments to override an automated system and avert disaster in simulations of problems with the Lion Air plane that crashed last fall.
articles.abstract: They had just moments to override an automated system and avert disaster in simulations of problems with the Lion Air plane that crashed last fall.
articles.lead_paragraph: During flight simulations recreating the problems with the doomed Lion Air plane, pilots discovered that they had less than 40 seconds to override an automated system on Boeing’s new jets and avert disaster.
articles.byline: By Jack Nicas, James Glanz and David Gelles

articles.headline: Is Gig Work a Job? Uber and Others Are Maneuvering to Shape the Answer
articles.snippet: Lobbyists are pressing legislatures, and sometimes working around them, to keep workers from being deemed employees and save the companies billions.
articles.abstract: Lobbyists are pressing legislatures, and sometimes working around them, to keep workers from being deemed employees and save the companies billions.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was a potentially sweeping proposal from a Texas regulator: Companies that use a “digital network” to dispatch workers the way Uber does could label them contractors rather than employees.

articles.headline: ‘I, Too, Was a Survivor’: Senator McSally Ends Years of Silence
articles.snippet: Martha McSally became the first American woman to fly in combat. But years before, she had been attacked by one of her own.
articles.abstract: Martha McSally became the first American woman to fly in combat. But years before, she had been attacked by one of her own.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Air Force of three decades ago was a challenging place for women, especially those ambitious few with aspirations of becoming fighter pilots.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper, Dave Philipps and Richard A. Oppel Jr

articles.headline: Interior Nominee Intervened to Block Report on Endangered Species
articles.snippet: While serving as deputy secretary, David Bernhardt, President Trump’s choice to lead the Interior Department, adopted a regulatory approach favored by the pesticide industry.
articles.abstract: While serving as deputy secretary, David Bernhardt, President Trump’s choice to lead the Interior Department, adopted a regulatory approach favored by the pesticide industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After years of effort, scientists at the Fish and Wildlife Service had a moment of celebration as they wrapped up a comprehensive analysis of the threat that three widely used pesticides present to hundreds of endangered species, like the kit fox and the seaside sparrow.

articles.headline: Europe Adopts Tough New Online Copyright Rules Over Tech Industry Protests
articles.snippet: The strict copyright law will require Google and other technology companies to compensate musicians, authors and news publishers.
articles.abstract: The strict copyright law will require Google and other technology companies to compensate musicians, authors and news publishers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Media companies whose business models have been upended by the internet have long complained about Google and other online platforms profiting from their content without compensating them adequately.
